text: Seahawks win NFC West, earn NFC’s top seed in playoffs after handling 49ers - The Seattle Times
fullText: The Seahawks showed why they might be back at Levi's Stadium next month for the Super Bowl after beating the 49ers 13-3 to win the NFC West title and top seed in the NFC.

text: Powerball winning numbers for Saturday, January 3, 2026 - USA Today
fullText: Who will win Powerball's first drawing of the year with a jackpot worth $64 million?

text: Box Office: ‘Avatar 3’ Flies Past $1B, Sleeper Hit ‘The Housemaid’ Delivers Sydney Sweeney a Win - The Hollywood Reporter
fullText: James Cameron's threequel achieved the milestone Saturday at the New Year weekend box office. Other holiday victors include sleeper hit 'The Housemaid' and Timothée Chalamet's 'Marty Supreme.'

text: Delta restarts Caribbean service - Delta News Hub
Leonardo DiCaprio To Miss Palm Springs Fest After Venezuela Strike - Deadline
fullText: Leonardo DiCaprio will be forced to miss his Palm Springs Film Festival honor due to air restrictions resulting from the U.S. attack on Venezuela.

text: Appeals panel says California's ban on open carry in more populated counties is unconstitutional - ABC News
fullText: The ruling was issued by two judges on the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals

text: Pete Hegseth says U.S. intervention in Venezuela is "exact opposite" of Iraq - CBS News
fullText: "We spent decades and decades and purchased in blood, and got nothing economically in return, and President Trump flips the script," Pete Hegseth said.

text: Who is María Corina Machado, Venezuela's Nobel Peace Prize winning opposition leader? - NPR
fullText: The United States has captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Opposition leader María Corina Machado has been one of his biggest critics.

text: A group of about 20 US investors is already planning a trip to Venezuela in March - Business Insider
fullText: Charles Myers, chairman of Signum Global Advisors, told Business Insider he is preparing a group of 15-20 investors to travel to Venezuela in March.

text: Rapid Reactions: Panthers fall to Bucs, division decided Sunday - Panthers.com
fullText: With both teams now 8-9, the division will be decided by the Falcons-Saints game Sunday, and the Panthers are hoping Atlanta can help.

text: How UK plush toy Jellycat conquered China - BBC
fullText: The plushies bring "emotional value" to Chinese youth navigating economic uncertainty.

text: Iran's leader says rioters 'must be put in their place' as protest death toll rises to at least 10 - PBS
fullText: Iran's supreme leader insisted Saturday that “rioters must be put in their place” after a week of protests that have shaken the Islamic Republic, likely giving security forces a green light to aggressively put down the demonstrations.

text: Buffett leaves, and Berkshire investors waste no time reacting - thestreet.com
fullText: Buffett is out, Greg Abel is in as Berkshire investors start to flinch.

text: Measles exposure found in NC - WRAL
fullText: A person carrying measles traveled through Gaston County while infectious, according to the North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services.
